title: Google reveals Chrome OS Flex for PCs and Macs, based on CloudReady OS
content:
Even though Chrome OS is only intended to be used on Chromebooks, there have been many projects over the years that aimed to bring the operating system to traditional PCs. One example is CloudReady OS, a fork of Chromium OS by Neverware primarily aimed at schools and businesses that wanted an updated software experience for

The post Google reveals Chrome OS Flex for PCs and Macs, based on CloudReady OS appeared first on xda-developers.
description: Google has revealed Chrome OS Flex, a new version of Chrome OS based on CloudReady OS that can be installed on traditional PCs.
